title: AI IN INVESTMENTS AND TRADING
description: Learn how AI is applied in investments, robo-advisors, and algorithmic trading to make smarter financial decisions.

blocks.content: Investing means putting money into assets like stocks, bonds, or mutual funds with the goal of growing your money over time. The key principle is that risk and return are connectedâ€”higher risks can lead to higher returns but also greater losses.
What are Stocks and Mutual Funds?

items.title: Stocks
items.content: Individual stakes in a company that can be bought by the public. The company's performance reflects on the value of the stock.

items.title: Mutual Funds
items.content: Pool money from many investors to invest in a diversified set of stocks, bonds, or other assets. The benefit is reduced risk because your money is spread across many investments.

blocks.content: In India, platforms like Zerodha or Groww allow people to invest in stocks or mutual funds easily through their apps.

A robo-advisor is an AI-driven tool that provides personalized investment advice based on an individual's financial situation, goals, and risk tolerance. They can often manage an entire portfolio. They are used in personal investment and by professional day traders and investment bankers.
AI Role: The AI looks at data such as age, income, financial goals, risk tolerance, and uses algorithms to suggest an investment portfolio that is most likely to meet those goals.

The user fills out a questionnaire to describe their investment goals (e.g., retirement, buying a home) and their risk tolerance (conservative, moderate, or aggressive). Based on this, the robo-advisors can recommend a diversified range of stocks, ETFs, bonds, and savings accounts to invest in.
Groww and SIP Calculator by Kuvera use AI to create personalized investment portfolios.
Trading algorithms use AI to make decisions on buying and selling investments. They use historical data, real-time market conditions, and complex models to predict the best times to trade.
Trading bots are programs that automatically execute trades based on the strategies set by the user. They can make decisions in milliseconds, helping traders take advantage of small price movements.
Platforms like Upstox and Zerodha offer tools for algorithmic trading, enabling traders to use AI to make faster, data-driven trading decisions.
